content: Getting a Joining Meeting failed message. I've tried signing out and back in.
Thanks for reporting. We are looking into it! We get multiple similar messages coming in.
@Emma Jones is that from your desktop?
Same here. Cannot join to any sessions. I refreshed my page to see the new questions coming in, but kicked out. This is a browser session.
yes
from my laptop
Maybe the meeting room was full? :D
For me, the mobile app works. Are you able to join the session through the mobile app ?
I was in and listening to the session

just wanted to add, same issue. Trying to access from a computer. Dev console shows: DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not load content for https://d1keuthy5s86c8.cloudfront.net/static/ems/upload/files/bootstrap.min.css.map: HTTP error: status code 403, net::ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE
Can you access via mobile?
yes. all else fails.
The phone app works fine, but screen is too small so it is not really ideal. Also, do we know if this will impact the other sessions this afternoon?
yes mobile works for me as well
Please use the mobile app while the staff is figuring this out.
Are we able to ask questions via mobile app? I see a 'raise hand' option but don't see where I can type questions
You can also snoop the zoom meeting ID from the signature?meeting_number=<x> request and join directly in Zoom, outside of Whova. You'll miss out on Q&A features though.
Just FYI, this requires downloading zoom if you don't already have it.

Also works with the Zoom web viewer. (To join in the browser, click the "join from browser" link, or if it's not present click "launch meeting" then cancel, and then the "join from browser" link appears -- it's a dark pattern from Zoom to keep people in their desktop app ;-))

image.png
Joining directly via zoom does work as others have suggested
All of a sudden I manage to get back in.
Yeah, Whova join is working for me again as well.
I am now in a loop joining and then disconnecting again :-(
